thread.title_full: Bradshaw's Second Half Surge Leads Memphis to 74-58 Win

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Bradshaw's Second Half Surge Leads Memphis to 74-58 Win
text:
Bradshaw’s Second Half Surge Leads Memphis to 74-58 Win
The Memphis Tigers secured a 74-58 victory over Southern Illinois, bouncing back from a recent slump. The win showcased the team's depth, with the bench contributing an impressive 50 points. Key performances came from Dug McDaniel and Julius Thedford, who each scored 15 points, while Aaron Bradshaw emerged as a second-half standout, scoring all 14 of his points after halftime. Memphis controlled the game defensively, limiting SIU’s leading scorer to just seven points.
- Memphis bench scored 50 points, contributing significantly to the team's offense.
- Aaron Bradshaw went 10-for-10 from the free-throw line, scoring all 14 points after halftime.
- Memphis held Southern Illinois to 31.0% shooting, including 2-for-15 from three-point range.
Despite the victory, the game exposed vulnerabilities, as Southern Illinois managed to stay competitive early on by capitalizing on Memphis' fouls, creating extra offensive opportunities.
State of Play- Memphis improved to 2-4, marking their first win in three games.
- The win sets a positive tone as they prepare for their next home game against New Orleans.
- This was the Tigers’ first meeting with Southern Illinois and a continuation of their strong record against Missouri Valley Conference teams.
Following the victory, Memphis will have a week to prepare for their next matchup against New Orleans on December 3. Potential adjustments may focus on sustaining rhythm and improving foul discipline.
Bottom LineThe Tigers' victory illustrates the importance of bench depth and defensive prowess in reclaiming momentum. Continued focus on team dynamics and performance consistency will be crucial as they move forward in the season.
Read more at University of Memphis Athletics
